column2: Simple feature collection with 64972 features and 29 fields
Guerrillas of the Freedom Fighters Front
Former Police Forces of Afghanistan (2021-) National Directorate of Security
Afghan Islamic Press News Agency; Amu TV; Hasht-e Subh; Khaama Press; Pajhwok Afghan News
Etilaat e Roz; ISW News; Twitter; Zawia News

Explosive remnants of war: On 28 April 2023, at least four children were killed and one was wounded by an explosive remnant of war while they're playing with it in the Dasht-e-Top village of Sayyid Abad district, Wardak.
On 27 April 2023, a former NDS policeman was arrested by the Taliban in Kabul. His whereabouts are unknown.

On 26 April 2023, the residents of Kandahar and Helmand provinces, who had recently moved to Herat, clashed with local residents in Herat province. The exact reason for the clash is unclear, but some Herati residents said that the Kandahari and Helmandi residents misbehaved with the local residents, while there are other claims that Kandahari and Helmandi Taliban members (not the residents) clashed with the residents of Herat. No more information.
On 25 April 2023, one person was killed and six were wounded during clashes over a land in the Ghorqand area of Chighcheran city, Ghor.

On 25 April 2023, Taliban forces engaged in an internal clash among each other in Doh Saraka, near the PD8 area of Jalalabad city, Nangarhar, resulting in the accidental killing of one child after a Taliban member started shooting in the area. The reason for the clash is unknown, and the Taliban refused to speak about it.
Around 24 April 2023 (as reported), Taliban forces shot dead a young man on charges of having connections with the anti-Taliban forces in Maimay (Darwaz) district [coded to Nusay], Badakhshan.

On 24 April 2023, unknown drones bombed Shira Wa Mandara village, bordering Khost Wa Firing district of Baghlan and Chal district, Takhar. Some reports claimed that the US and Taliban carried out a joint air and ground operation against the IS militants that resulted in the killing and arresting of several IS fighters, while some others including pro-NRF sources claimed that the strike was conducted at a Taliban base, resulting in the killing and wounding of more than ten people (assumed Taliban). No further information. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 22 April 2023, Taliban forces closed the mosques of Shiite Muslim groups in Ghazni province and did not allow them to hold the Eid al-Fitr prayers. The Taliban also severely beat one of the Shiite religious scholars because of his insistence to perform Eid prayers.

On 22 April 2023, Guerrillas of the Freedom Corps Front claimed to kill a number of Taliban forces in an attack to their vehicle in Doghundi Karez village of the Spin Boldak, Kandahar. Fatalities coded as 3 (Guerrillas of the Freedom Corps Front claimed killing five Taliban members, including the commander of Spin Boldak checkpoint).

On 21 April 2023, Taliban forced Shiite residents of in Nili city, Daykundi to break their fast and celebrate the first day of Eid Al-Fitr on the same day as Sunnis (Shiite Muslims, don't always observe Eid the same day as Sunni Muslims). Taliban severely beaten a civilian who protested the Taliban demands.
